response:
A solitary right pontine lesion in a 40-year-old with subacute (weeks) evolution and internuclear ophthalmoplegia strongly suggests an inflammatory demyelinating brainstem plaque, but vascular, neoplastic, and infectious causes must be excluded because management differs substantially.

differential_diagnosis = ["Right pontine demyelinating plaque due to multiple sclerosis", "Right pontine ischaemic stroke (lacunar infarct of basis/tegmentum)", "Intrinsic brainstem neoplasm (e.g., low-grade pontine glioma)", "Brainstem cavernous malformation with subacute haemorrhage", "Infective brainstem encephalitis or rhombencephalitis (e.g., Listeria monocytogenes)"]
